content.rendered:
Kenneth Nichols O’Keefe, a far-right activist and former U.S. Marine, has openly supported terrorist organizations like Hamas, while promoting dangerous antisemitic and neo-Nazi ideologies. O’Keefe’s involvement in the infamous Gaza flotilla incident in 2010, where he attempted to aid Hamas by challenging Israeli defense forces, underscores his direct alignment with violent terrorist activities. His extremist rhetoric, which calls for the destruction of Israel and perpetuates antisemitic conspiracy theories, further reveals his dangerous sympathies.

O’Keefe has consistently engaged with Hamas leaders, praising their political and military actions, all while refusing to acknowledge the terrorist organization’s brutal tactics, including the murder, rape and targeting of innocent Israeli civilians. By aligning with Hamas and promoting violent, hateful ideologies, O’Keefe has positioned himself as a sympathizer of terrorism.

Anyone who follows or supports O’Keefe’s views risks being associated with violent extremism. His open calls for the destruction of Israel, along with his antisemitic and neo-Nazi propaganda, contribute to the dangerous normalization of terrorist support and hatred against Jews and the Jewish state.
